intro: Conostylis breviscapa, commonly known as the short-stemmed conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces pink or purple flowers during the warmer months. Conostylis breviscapa is a hardy species that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
